DOC.brief_summary: This study was to assess the safety and efficacy of sofosbuvir (GS-7977; PSI-7977) in combination with ribavirin (RBV) administered for 12 weeks compared with pegylated interferon (PEG)/RBV administered for 24 weeks in treatment-naive patients with Hepatitis C (HCV) genotype 2 or 3. Efficacy was assessed by the rate of sustained viral response (SVR) 12 weeks after the discontinuation of therapy (SVR12). This was a non-inferiority study, and if non-inferiority was demonstrated, the study was then allowed to test for superiority.
DOC.brief_title: Phase 3 Study of Sofosbuvir and Ribavirin
DOC.criteria: Chronic Genotype 2 or 3 HCVinfection Naive to all HCV antiviral treatment(s) Positive test at Screening for HBsAg, antihepatitis B core immunoglobulin M antibody (antiHBc IgM Ab), or antiHIV Ab History of any other clinically significant chronic liver disease A history consistent with decompensated liver disease History or current evidence of psychiatric illness, immunologic disorder, hemoglobinopathy, pulmonary or cardiac disease, seizure disorder or anticonvulsant use, poorly controlled diabetes, cancer, or a history of malignancy, that makes the subject unsuitable for the study. Participation in a clinical study within 3 months prior to first dose
